title: Higher Education Assessment Design Profile Analysis and Simulation-Based Practical Training

context.prior_knowledge: Three or more years of teaching experience, understanding of basic assessment design concepts, and experience in science subject instruction
context.additional_context: A program focusing on enhancing science curriculum assessment design competencies for in-service elementary teachers, utilizing smartphone-based simulation tools in limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain characteristics of three assessment design profiles (feasibility/learning objective alignment/teaching method alignment)
Learners can analyze their own thinking patterns while designing science subject assessment tools using think-aloud simulation techniques
Learners can propose practical assessment plans considering real classroom constraints (e.g., resource limitations)

resources: Science Curriculum Learning Outcome Standards Document
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
